intro: Asterosedum, commonly known as stonecress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They produce small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink or purple, often blooming in early spring. Asterosedum species are generally low-growing, with succulent-like leaves that help them retain moisture. Many species are used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
